RC0iOsIZQUPp_yTE4pjU5Q.text: Each experience I've had at Lidia's was positive.  I've visited the restaurant several times, but mostly for lunch or brunch.  The food is delicious and well prepared, though it can be a bit pricey.  I've visited Lidia's most frequently for brunch, and find the value to be top-notch.  For $25, you have a large antipasti table selection, your choice of entree, a generous dessert table selection, and complimentary mimosa or Bloody Mary.  Other restaurants of this caliber would charge separately for all this food, putting the total bill far higher.  The foods are fresh and reflect a wide variety of Italian foods, not necessarily the same foods you would find at your corner Italian restaurant featuring spaghetti and lasagna.    The food is good, but perhaps doesn't quite meet the high expectations people have before their first visit.  Letting go of the unnatural expectation that every bite of food you eat from a celebrity chef restaurant will be life-changing, you will have a pleasant and positive experience at Lidia's.    When we excitedly told the wait staff we were celebrating my birthday with them, they brought me a complimentary flour-less chocolate cake which was absolutely incredible.  The service at Lidia's is incomparable, always making you feel like the king or queen of the room.     I would recommend Lidia's to anyone looking for a quality Italian lunch or dinner with an upscale atmosphere.  This restaurant would be great for dates and special occasions.

-6hMLluKXZfABQDTe0KVrg.text: Overall we enjoyed the experience at Lydia's.   The ambience , service and food were all very good. We started with deep fried artichokes with a mustard aioli. ...lightly breaded and cooked perfectly.  We shared their Caesar salad...a favorite  they say and done very well..great favors in the dressing.  My only ding is that they slightly over dressed the lettuce for my liking.  Then my husband and I both ordered the pasta trio...on this day they served a potato leek ravioli, a basil parmesan tagliatelle and a sausage, fennel rigatoni.  All were very good however, both of us liked the rigatoni best...with lots of flavors in the meat sauce.  We also enjoy wine with our pasta a nice bottle of white wine but for an upscale Italian restaurant the quality of the wine glasses was mediocre and thus swayed us toward a lower cost wine.

FLkMfpk_Z0Djnl4dnMTsIg.text: Wow, should have listened to the recent Yelp reviews, but always wanted to try this restaurant because I've been a fan of Lidia's, growing up on her PBS  TV show.   Had reservations for a Sunday night at 7 pm and when I called to make them, the hostess asked if there were any celebrations. I told her my nephew and SIL were both celebrating birthdays on that day. She then informed me that they could either order desserts from the menu or if they didn't pick one, then they would chose one, both instances complimentary. I thought that was a very nice touch.   Got there around 6:50 and a few people were waiting. Informed the hostess we had reservations and she said we would be seated momentarily. There were 7 of us. Her definition and mine of " "momentarily" must be different, as we didn't get seated until 7:25; even though half the restaurant was empty. That's already leaving a bad taste in my mouth. There were plenty of tables available.   In our group, three people ordered the pasta trio, deluxe, I had the Sunday special, son ordered eggplant parmigiana, hubby had the chicken lemone, and SIL, the Osso Busso. Also had 2 bottles of wine. Oh, and salads aren't included in the meals and are quite pricy. $10 for a plain green salad with no olives, just a few chopped up tomatoes and onions.   Server brought salads, and had to ask if he could please bring out the bread basket. Said it was in the oven. Finally he brought it out and unlike the pictures posted, contents looked nothing like them. One small breadbasket consisting of a few breadsticks and small pieces of what I think is their focciacia bread, along with some small crumbly things, no Italian bread slices and it was served cold. So much "for it being in the oven."  Was expecting it to be at least warm, especially from a restaurant with these prices. Looked like they rounded up the scraps from the other diners's basket.   A few meals were okay, son received only two pieces of eggplant, unlike the three shown on yelp photos, and he was still hungry. SIL hated  her Osso Bucco, hardly ate any of it, yet the waiter never asked if it was ok. Seeing most of the meal left  on her plate, you'd think he would have asked if there was a problem. My Sunday supper special and husband's chicken lemone were ok, nothing special. We've definitely had better at other restaurants.   In addition to these overpriced meals being mediocre, what really lacked was attention from the server. He brought the entrees over and left the salad plates on the table. Had to ask him to remove them. Had to ask him repeatedly for more bread, hoping we would get a better selection.  I don't know if he was new or what the problem was, but we have had better service at a Denny's.   And, the most disappointing part of the evening?  No mention of the two birthdays being  celebrated and acknowledged. No complimentary birthday desserts for them as we were promised. No "happy birthday" written on desserts plates, nothing. So much for wanting to surprise my family. My husband brought it to the waiter's  attention and his reply? "Oh, no one told me."   No one came around the entire night and asked how our meals were either.   Two separate checks were presented and they were wrong. Having items on it that we didn't order and/or were on the wrong check.   What really made me upset is that we expected a nice evening out, celebrating my family's birthdays and this "fine dining" experience was anything but.   Ironically husband and I ate at a small Italian restaurant in Wexford the night before, and on several occasions,   the owner and manager and waitress came over, asking how our meals were. Their bread was plentiful and served warm. Their waitress didn't leave dirty dishes on the table. She frequently checked back with us. And it was more than half of what we paid at Lidias.   That's the difference between a great Italian restaurant and one surviving on their brand name. Lidia needs to be taking more of an active interest in her restaurant because not only the food, but the service is sub par. And, no, we won't be returning here. Ever.

bzzAUmLtgMnE7T3QQ5KasA.text: Extremely underwhelming experience.  Cannot recommend this restaurant.  Our Saturday brunch meal was plentiful, but tasteless--absent of flavor.  It seemed each dish was missing a key ingredient or two. The fresh fruit was excellent.  Service and ambiance were fine; less the air smelling like a dirty mop.  Manager spoke to the table, but quickly moved on before anyone responded.

t-AOCka_0aOlUPRo-gW8Lw.text: Fantastic restaurant. Great service.  The hubs ordered chocolate ravioli with butternut squash filling. The pasta is so fresh and light. Flavors are amazing.  Always have a great experience here.

0b_Cq_qdylc_UwbPBt4NXg.text: good italian food, not as good as the nyc sister restaurants    the attention to details is not up to lidias standards  lamb was very good  would have like more gluten free dishes  the vegetable dishes were not very good  way undercooked

uJR4t4NeNg5U2CwEZWoypQ.text: I feel ripped off at Lidias. For two people you're spending a minimum of $80-100 for lackluster Italian food. I ordered the Gnoochi which comes with duck, however substituted duck for chicken. The server said there would be a small upcharge... received my gnocchi with red sauce and half a chicken breast. Nothing special about the taste... they charged me $20 for the gnoochi duck and another $12 for half a chicken breast! My fiance ordered a $24 chicken dish.. we expected it to come with pasta or sides or something! Just two chicken breasts over a little bit of spinach for color... $8.50 to add a bowl of plain (no sauce) pasta! All and all not impressed with the value, taste, or experience. Oh and can't forget to mention they charged us a cake cutting fee!

esvNHZO9hyIHldhNjoCTAQ.text: My husband and I went here with great expectations, as we had heard the food was really good.  While the food was okay, it is the seating that needs some attention.  When you walk in there are tables everywhere, but mainly for 4 or more.  If you are a party of two, you are seated right next to, or very near the waitstaff station, which means there are people constantly walking past your table.    Our table was right across from the waitstaff station so we were met with looking at waitstaff's bottoms all night, and our conversations were interrupted with the noise of dishes, glasses and waitstaff complaining about customers.  Instead of having a nice romantic dinner, we had a dinner where we could not really have a conversation.  It's almost as if parties of two are being punished as this is an absolutely horrible place to sit, completely ruins the dinner.   The food is decent, not as good as we had hoped.  My husband had stuffed cabbage, it was pretty good.  I had salmon and it was pretty salty. During dinner our waitress asked if I would like another glass of wine, I said yes, and I never received it.  When we asked for our check she said, "you didn't want another glass of wine did you?"  Obviously she remembered at that point and tried to cover.  I think she forgot as she was dealing with a problem at another table, we heard the whole conversation as she complained to another waiter.  This was a place we were looking forward to visiting on our visit to Pittsburgh, but unfortunately it was a disappointment.

9Dn0jdGsw1kXgJYrneKm7A.text: This was our first time here. It was for my mom's bday. She always wanted to try it. we were a table of 10 (3 kids)  on a Saturday we had a reservation. the staff was very friendly and the place was packed. let me say my family is Italian American so we don't normally eat Italian when we eat out. The octopus appetizer was good. everyone who got the house salad with their meal all said the same thing the dressing was bland. I got the Caesar Salad with my dinner and it was good. I had the Gnoochi with Duck Ragu, I should have take an picture to show how small the portion was. The Gnoochi were nothing to brag about I've had better. The braised duck sauce was good I will say but the portion was laughable at $20.  It was literally slopped on a plain white plate. Normally I can't eat a lot of gnoochi but this portion size I was able to so it was really small. My sister got the pasta trio, for homemade pasta and none of us were that impressed. It was just ok. My husband had the meatball app and the pork chop. The meatballs were not good and the pork chop looked like it was just covered with red sauce and mozzarella, what is that? I never get red sauce when I go out I make it so much that I am always underwhelmed. My two youngest kids got the spaghetti and meatballs and said it was like Eat n park spaghetti and meatballs. THAT'S BAD! My Mom liked her duck breast I tried it (we all tried each other's food) it was good. The polenta was ok but you could tell the dish sat under the heat lamp it was gummy. My cousin enjoyed her ravioli and my Aunt and older son had the salmon which was good but again overpriced and the portion and presentation needed work. My niece said the baked ziti was ok. I did appreciate they let my 12 year of son and 13 year old niece order from the kids menu. We brought our own cake which they charge $20 just to cut which I knew and was fine with. Now our sever was very friendly but he was busy and we had long waits in between courses. He forgot my husband's drink and my cousin ordered a second drink which never came. The manager caught it and made sure we weren't charged. Our water was kept filled and the food runners were very nice. We waited about 25 minutes for the cake to be served from the time we asked for it, by then our coffee was cold. The coffee was luke warm and tasted like it was old. My Mom enjoyed herself and they didn't rush us we talked and laughed which I appreciated. Nothing worse than being rushed. We're not the type to complain for the sake of complaining. I love Lidia's cook books I have made several of her dishes. But this was disappointing and I don't think I will ever go back. I know Saturdays they are pushing food out but quality control is sorely lacking and the prices are crazy for the food quality and portion sizes. I will pay any amount if the food is great. My Mom was happy so that was all that mattered. There are much better Italian restaurants in Pittsburgh. Lidia's is mediocre food you are paying for a name.

bxXSU2EkyJaM5U3uVhGYaA.text: So, we've been here twice.  As a rule, I don't write a review of a restaurant until I've been twice.  Having a good or poor experience on a first visit could be a fluke.  Enough chat, on with the review.  We wanted to love this place, but there are several factors that just leave this place lacking.    On the first visit, we ordered two glasses of wine, the calamari for an appetizer, and tried their tableside pasta service.  The calamari was good and cooked correctly.  However, the three types of pasta we tried in their tableside service were not good.  The flavors were muddy and the pasta itself was very overcooked.  In retrospect, I should've known better than to order the tableside pasta, as I could've guessed the pasta was sitting in the back on a sterno waiting to be served.  Pasta should only be served fresh, as sitting under or over heat will continue to cook the pasta.  And quite honestly, the price for the app, entrees and wine were pretty steep.  On our second visit, they initially sat the two of us at this huge round 4 top.  It was difficult to have a conversation between the two of us and awkward sitting at this giant table alone.  Additionally, the table next to us had a toddler banging on the plates with the silverware.  It was obvious that we were there as a couple to have a date night.  Ultimately, we requested a more adequate table.  For our meal, we ordered the grilled octopus as an appetizer, the hubby ordered the lamb shank, I ordered the pork chop, and we ordered brussels sprouts for the table.  The octopus was good, but there was an abundance of red pepper on the dish and my palette was completely engulfed in spice.  The entrees were extremely bland.  I was searching all over for the salt and pepper shakers, but there are none to be found on the table.  Unfortunately, they refuse to add any salt or pepper to their dishes, and refuse to provide you the option to add any at the table.  Again, the bill at the end of the night was extreme and we walked away realizing that this place charges an arm and a leg for their bland food simply to pay for the rent and decor.  Pros: Convenient for residents of The Strip Decor is beautiful Service is impeccable  Cons: Food is very bland - absolutely no flavor Pasta isn't great Prices are way too high for the quality of food they are serving No real consideration for the comfort of their guests  End result - We won't be going back.

2261CfFd4ONFXC7uQKdSWg.text: We had a great experience !  Very nice place for date night.  Sat at bar and the bartender, Anand, could not have been better.  Great wine recommend and mixed an excellent Manhattan.   Made some great suggestions for a dinner and the sides were crazy good.

Ne8mKGPhisua1T1t8Ld97Q.text: Osso Bucco good, risotto ok. Could do without the citrus in it.

-HhgEpihQ9JcW15W5lOaMA.text: We did the works: three course fixed menu, wine, hours filling up the restaurant with laughter. It may be my best restaurant experience to date.   The newly renovated restaurant is amazing. A little Art Deco influence amongst the industrial strip district is a beautiful juxtaposition that makes you forget where you are.   We had wine from Lidia's vineyard -- a nice white that was not too sweet and not too dry -- perfect with our Caesar salads.  Which after the salad alone, I was pretty full.   Three pastas: walnut pesto, mushroom ravioli, and a savory meat sauce. It was a lot to handle.   Finished with a beautiful and immaculate dessert which you don't think you have room for until you take one bite and suddenly you've cleaned your plate.   My experience here was nothing less than excellent. The executive chef here is running a fantastic kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Lidia's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Torts di Cioccolato e Castagne

o-1K3kPys5wj7h7gSo9Htg.text: Went with my family on a day trip to Pittsburgh to visit Lidia's. My family and friend who tagged along are very big fans of Lidia's show on the Food Network.   We arrived during the brunch time. We were given the choice of a complimentary mimosa or some other alcoholic drink that I do not remember. I chose the mimosa and it was very good. The champagne and orange juice really complimented each other.   The appetizers/salad bar thing was pretty good. Not really all that extraordinary. The Caesar salad could have used more cheese and dressing in my opinion.   Entree was very good. I had the beef roast with Swiss chard mashed potatoes and a red wine sauce. I was able to use just a fork to cut into the meat. It was very tender and had the perfect amount of fat. My friend said her gnocchi with duck ragu was good, but was a little bit cold when it was brought out. She opted not to send it back to be reheated.   The tiramisu dessert was absolutely delicious. It is the only dessert I chose because I absolutely love tiramisu.   The service was pretty good. Our server was nice and attentive, but he was almost too attentive. He hovered around the table a lot. I was very uncomfortable most of the time. My family was also a bit uncomfortable as well.

sVoNJ9D7ooz9XljcE4BeBA.text: I was not sure about updating my review but my experience at Lidia's was so much different then my last meals I felt the need to.  Please note that I have only dined here for their Prix Fixe Brunch. I do not know when they raised their Brunch price but it is now $32.00 per person.  The menu is still the same and the staff is friendly and attentive.  I ordered the pork chop.  The most noticeable change is their buffet table.  It is 1/2 the size it used to be and the selections on the tables are few.  It was very disappointing how they raised the price $4 per person and downsized their buffet.  Most of the buffet table was occupied by two huge bowls of Cesar salad and then a small plate of luncheon meats with hardly any cheese, one small platter of eggplant, one terrine of soup, a hot plate of warm olives, and greens, two medium bowls of pasta salad. Off to the side was a very small table with 2 desserts and cookies.  Now this may sound like a decent buffet but previously the table was twice the size with many, many more choices of food, and better choices.  The dessert table had at least 5 desserts and cookies.   All in all the food was OK, but I was saddened by the buffet experience. Costing $32 per person, there are much better places to dine.

kvEniHIDX3veqlxqrUWMRA.text: i wanted *really* badly to like lidia's, but landed on 3 stars.  -1 for the hours on the yelp site being wrong.  which led to my wife and i walking from downtown twice--once when they were closed, and once more (later) when they were open.  the worker was nice, and explained how changing the hours on yelp was impossible due to a "corporate thing".  i just submitted an edit on yelp, wasn't that hard.  to make up for the mixup, they gave us a reservation for later and seated us at a "table with a view".  it was a nice gesture, but the view was underwhelming (just a window outside).  the worker was really nice about it.  my wife ordered the trio, but only liked 1 of the 3.  we did enjoy how they brought the skillet right to our table, 1 at a time, to serve the trio.  i had the gnocchi with duck ragu.  it was above average, but didn't take the cake.  the duck was tender, but slightly more on the gamey side than expected.  overall, it was a fine dining experience, but "just" fine.  we've crossed it off our to-eat list; we don't need to return.

EFEPWT9NUAC5DluPfdKaAA.text: I had some great baked manicotti with a side of their fabulous meatballs.  One of my colleagues got the pasta trio that is served table side and unlimited. Everyone's food was great.  The ambiance is also really nice, especially given it feels a little out in the middle of nowhere.  We are glad we decided to Uber rather than walk from our hotel.  We were also blown away by the prices--really reasonable.  The only down side, despite them not being at all busy...the service seemed super slow and at times inattentive.  We felt we had to flag down wait staff to assist us.  II sensed they were trying to give our party of 5 leisurely fine dining but even with a big group that wanted time to chat...we all would have preferred a bit more attention.

g5NIcD5Vp6xypkKrEbSggQ.text: We dined with a party of 6 on a Saturday night. Was surprised it wasn't that busy. My mom and Aunt had said they always wanted to eat here. I called the day of to schedule reservations while some family had just gotten into town for a funeral.   We had Andy as our waiter, and he was pretty fantastic! His friendly banter with my family was great! Just what we needed.   We ordered, wine, champagne, beer across the board for the table. All reasonable, but they had options for higher end clientele, too! The mix of breads and spreads for the butter was very good. Loved the crunchy breadsticks.   I ordered a Caesar salad and split with my Aunt. My mother ordered the Osso Buco, so I knew it would be awhile and Andy also warned us. I also ordered the Eggplant Parm. It reminded me more of a napoleon ( which maybe I missed when reading the menu). I was surprised it didn't come with pasta, but that was actually perfect, because I couldn't even finish the 3 stacks of the eggplant that arrived.   Andy was so sweet, he brought us a Tiramasu for the table.   Will definitely recommend to our Pittsburgh friends and family, thanks for treating us like family while visiting.

-QExdQhqb0-kOv_shT8ygg.text: Food was inconsistent. We had the pasta tasting trio. Some parts of the meal were brilliant some were a big miss. All the wait staff seemed unhappy. Not very attentive and were bickering with each other in front of us. I wouldnt do it again.

YCpnwC0xbnUnZxJEcS23Fg.text: First time at Lidia's. Staff was courteous and prompt. We went on Mardi Gras Day..they had a special four course meal in celebration. My boyfriend ordered that.. each course was so delicious!!  I ordered the salmon..also very good!  We shared tiramisu which was the best desert I've ever had at a restaurant. Definitely recommend!  The presentation was appealing and the restaurant seemed very clean.

ww_TfzC3eDbRxKaCHeXusg.text: Lidia's service and food has fallen far from what it once was.   Tonight's meal was a series of small errors that added up all evening.  First was a bottle of wine that was not the year described in the listing.   Next was an appetizer we were told was not available 15 minutes after we ordered it.   Yet the charge for it remained in our tab.  And the worst was a very loud table of 8 that was extremely loud disturbing the entire second floor.   I mean singing and  banging on the tables is great if we are at a beer hall, but not a fine restaurant.  No comments were made by staff.   The pork chop was tough but well seasoned.  Steak was tough.  Cappuccino cup was dirty with a hair in the coffee.  Too bad as we are fans.

RKI8TwT0rL8Q1TSwNp0OGg.text: The restaurant is very nice, but the food was very disappointing. We had the Frico for an appetizer and it was disgustingly salty and soaked in grease. Even the bread they gave us was extremely salty. I had chicken Parmesan for my meal and it was very good. My boyfriend had the pasta trio and only one of the pastas was good- the other two were very over seasoned and not very good.   The worst part about this place though is the service. We sat for 20 minutes waiting for our waitress. We were never asked if we wanted another drink and barely ever saw our waitress after the first time she came around. The pasta trio was supposed to be unlimited but we could never find someone to come to our table to give us more.  Overall, a disappointing experience. Would give it 2 stars, but the chicken Parmesan was surprisingly good. Would not recommend overall though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lidia's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Parmesan. This was our only good meal of the night.

jZQNXNJdiQExy_BGm54K9A.text: So I have been to Lydia's several times. I am here in Pittsburgh for work and thought I could sit outside for dinner on this warm summer night. I asked the waitress if I could be seated outside and she said "we do not allow outside eating" . While she is saying this I am looking at the tables and chairs outside! And I have eaten outside there before. So the young lady did not know what she was talking  about. I later come to find it that there was a cocktail party on the patio that night. That is all she needed to tell me. They probably don't need my business but they should treat professionals with some good old fashion respect!!

_yIRoE1LVKlpPNtWqhfKtQ.text: I went for my birthday on a Thursday around 6 and the restaurant was not very busy, there were tons of open tables and no one at the bar. All the servers were very nice but it took over 10 minutes to get our water then another 15 minutes to take our order. We didn't get out of the restaurant until 830.   I had gone twice to Lidia's around a year ago and the food was phenomenal, the restaurant was busy as could be and we still got our food at a reasonable time.   This time around, we all order the pasta trio and the shrimp pasta was tasteless with the shrimp being so tiny and over cooked. I do not eat meat and the one pasta had meat so I asked the server if I could just have a pasta with red sauce instead but she was very hesitant to asked the chef and never came back to tell us if he was able to do it or not. The only this I got seconds of was the gnocchi which was good but so rich it was hard to eat more of. I was very disappointed to come here for my birthday and have fine dining food be so tasteless.

4CvtvN6GukIljMyVCIZZHg.text: Lidia's has a good reputation as a great place for some delicious Italian food. I have only eaten here once for the Sunday brunch which included a drink, buffet, entree and dessert buffet. I had their signature all you can eat trio entree which was very good and I would definitely get again. The desserts were the only thing I found underwhelming, disappointing and not worth the calories. Maybe it was just the buffet desserts. Prices are moderate but well worth it in my opinion. Atmosphere is classy but casual attire seemed acceptable. The staff was both professional and knowledgeable. Can't wait to come back!

QvQLj-LL0fkTtvS8TCjtmw.text: We were staying at the Homewood Suites next door... after an afternoon of wandering around the area we weren't really looking forward to walking back out in the cold to get dinner... ordered from Lidia's and they delivered to the lobby....  Best butternut squash meal I've ever had... I order it whenever it's on a menu where I'm eating so I've had it a lot... that chocolate pasta - WOW - just enough sage butter (I hate when it's swimming in the butter)... most amazing pasta I've ever had.. husband got the Sunday special of sauce with sausage and meatball - equally impressed... also had the beet salad - so good.... and then the cannoli - light and lemony with whole pistachios... heavenly .... so happy we were lazy and ordered in as it was truly enjoyable

aoglFGi3910hGjLcL83jWg.text: Joined friends for dinner at Lidia's, located next door to Homewood Suites. What a delightful meal we enjoyed. Everybody we encountered were friendly and welcoming. A huge shout out to our server, Laurie. We all felt that she exemplified service. The tasting menu plus salad and dessert was a great value and I highly recommend to try that, unless your heart is set on one of Lidia's other fabulous dishes. Don't miss having a meal here when in Pittsburgh.

nLTqQVx1fXGQkUnotwX8DQ.text: Came on a Wednesday night with a big group for a business dinner. Seated immediately, and initial drink and bread service was quick. Good first impression but downhill from there. Service got slow and unattentive - glasses sitting empty (both wine and water), empty appetizer plates sitting too long. Entrees took an absurdly long time to arrive and the dining room was not even busy. Unfortunately, though the appetizers were good enough, the entrees disappointed. Meat cooked properly but not particularly flavorful. Plates were too simple, lacked balance (too much starch or not enough; too dry or too much sauce, etc). Pasta unimpressive. We then ordered desserts and cocktails. By the time the drinks arrived, most had already finished their dessert! Ridiculous.

yFRNS2flPo9G_mI0i7y37Q.text: We want to love this place, but it's just so uneven. We were there 2 weeks ago and it was wonderful, but last night it was just awful. The service was terrible and the food was not good. We waited a long time to be greeted by our waitress and it took forever to get drinks. Those that ordered the pasta trio only got 2 of the 3 and when we complained, the waitress said all 3 would be coming back out, after another wait the same 2 dishes came out again with the 3rd finally following. We could hear the wait staff talking to one another and complaining about the kitchen and other customers in the restaurant. Very unprofessional. For the prices they charge they need to do better. With service like that they can't survive on Lidia's reputation. There are too many good restaurants in Pittsburgh to waste your money on Lidias.

jtiGHtcJ9Wjb3cox5jYCFA.text: I would have given 5 stars if not for the horrible hostess who let us sit there for a while before gracing us with her presence.... which by the way was awful. She looked as if she just gotten out of bed sniffling and letting us know she hates her job and was not happy to be there by her horrible attitude  We were there yesterday morning at 11 for brunch, and it was amazing... our waiter was extremely polite and accommodating, took the time to explain the brunch menu with a smile and was very attentive the entire time. Our food was fantastic. I had the frittata with ricotta cheese and tomato, it was delicious. They also have a fantastic antipasto table that was fantastic. After all of that we were offered sampling's of many different wonderful desserts.  Everything with the exception of the hostess was great, highly highly recommend for brunch

V7Y-q1fyPCN6TPJrg8hpQw.text: The food was good; the burrata was one of the best things I have eaten in a while, the octopus was exquisite. Major stars off for service.  We were greeted with an inquiry about our water choice, so far so good.  There was never a question if we wanted other drinks; I had to ask. Drink was not delivered with the requested garnish. The food was served fast, too fast. It was rushed for an Italian meal, especially with a very open dining room.  The pasta course was ordered to be shared and it arrived with the main entrees--called on the menu "Secondi" for apparently no reason.  Double espresso was served without a spoon.  When the waiter was asked for a spoon, he deputized another server and waited on the table next to us.  A soup spoon was brought.  When I asked for a different spoon, the deputy come to the table holding the spoon out and asks, "Is this what you want?"  On the way out, the greeter asked how the meal was, when we said that the service was bad, we got a, "I'm sorry."  There was no "In what way?" or  "How can we  fix it."    Not the professionalism I would have expected at Lidia's.

92985WVEsNkRwO-QFjUK3g.text: Very nice atmosphere. We had excellent service. Cesar salad was fantastic. We both have the Sunday special pasta which was very tasty. Have the cannoli for dessert which was good. I would definitely come back.

N71GvTjDV-7p1i94oqbGNQ.text: First of all, feels like a chain from jump street. Service is uninspired and sloppy. Drinks were executed poorly and weak. Bottom line we ordered signature Pasta Trio and it was just meh. This place is just a notch above Olive Garden...it's loud but not horrible, good for big groups.  I love Lidia on the tube, I expected authentic, fresh and simple...nope.

wJ_jpNaOzGpxyHBJOA19Sg.text: In Pitts for a business trip. Went here for a client lunch. Went during prime lunch hour 12-1:30 and the place was very empty. This place is meh. There were 6 of us. Half of us didn't care for our dishes.   We ordered:  Soft shell crab sandwich - 3/5 stars because they of too much sauce on the sandwich. Was too messy to eat well. I was told they just added this sandwich to the menu as of Monday...4 days ago  Smoked salmon salad - was told it wasn't that great  Grilled salmon - was told the mustard sauce served atop the dish wasn't that great   Service: server was very nice and polite. But he was so slow. We mentioned we needed to get back to a business meeting to speed things up. Didn't make a difference. As mentioned earlier, the place wasn't busy at all   Overall, I wouldn't strongly recommend this place. I don't even live in this state, so I can't come back soon to give it another try.

DW7XT4ScLrC_5tbKzNFCyw.text: We're locals who hadn't come here yet, but had out of town guests (parents, aunt and uncle) who had eaten at other branches and were insistent on going.  Plenty of good Italian elsewhere in Pittsburgh, but we tried hard to give it a chance.  Came on a fairly busy Saturday night, but had a reservation and were very happy to be seated right at our prompt arrival.  Received menus but no wine list upon seating.  Server greeted us nicely, but it really went south from there.  Long story short, it was over half an hour before a drink order was even taken (seriously? isn't the bar the biggest profits in the house?).  Even if the kitchen is slammed (I'm very, very tolerant on a busy night) at least bring the drinks and I can be extremely patient.  45 min before cocktails came.  Almost an hour with menus sitting in front of us.  Very, very, not cool.  Appetizers finally came at some point, highlight of the night.  To be fair, the aranchini and zucchini fritters were quite good.  I'll credit them for the second star.  The lemon chicken I ordered as an entree was good but nothing special.  I was glad I avoided the pasta tasting, but others at my table did.  As other reviewers have described, there is nothing at all special about it.  Even though the servers are tonging it out of a frying pan, it's clear visually and from the taste that the pastas are scooped out of a warmed-over hotel pan, and not remotely cooked to order.  While more than good enough for banquet food or weekday leftovers at home, completely disappointing and unacceptable for a good neighborhood Italian restaurant, let alone an establishment passing it off as fine dining.  Service was very polite, but super slow and disorganized.  I didn't have huge expectations for the food, but really wanted to give it a chance.  Sadly, it was quite disappointing.  Having eaten at several other B&B restaurants, I know this group can turn out some excellent dining experiences.  It's so unfortunate they seem to have completely lost their mojo in Pittsburgh.

dNCHPNCNWQz0O0TsMGIfSg.text: Same as it ever was.  The decor is the same as it was the last time I was here. (Can't believe it's been 5 years).  Stopped in for lunch. Had the pasta trio. Crab meat ravioli, fettuccine  with spinach, and rigatoni with bolognese sauce. Good stuff.  Why did a star come off after 5 years? It seemed to me the wait staff for the lunch time patrons was in training, so the service seemed a bit sluggish and off. Other than that, the food was great.

kVF93mYiXXT_pQAqat5lYA.text: How the mighty have fallen. This once lovely Italian spot has fallen into ruin much like Ancient Rome itself. And the sad part is no one seems to care! Lidia where are you standards? Joe you talk a big game on tv but how could you let this become of your families restaurant? The food has lost its spark, the Osso bucco was over cooked the risotto was not flavored just tasting of store bought chicken stock with no salt. The staff looked uninterested and now the big one...the carpet! This place has been open for almost two decades and the carpet smells of it! It is disgusting! Mold and mildew will great your senses as you enter! Puts off the appetite. Maybe that's why you can't fill reservations on a weekend night? Only the finest and fewest restaurants should have carpet. It takes care to keep it from smelling. People here don't care and so it stinks! And it stinks bad! Will not go back until changes are made!

Ry-brFjhh8pbf5qVFep4rw.text: I had a really great experience here the atmosphere was lovely, the waitress was super friendly and made amazing suggestions and the food over all was great. The salad was fresh and the entrees were really great and you get a lot for the price. I had enough to take some home as leftovers. Even as left overs the next day the food was great. Would definitely go again for another date night!

Yf1qmpez2OgOh6SWFdjORA.text: We used to enjoy Lidia's but it seems they have fallen off.  We arrived promptly for our reservation at noon for our brunch, and was promptly seated. From there it fell apart. Being familiar with the restaurant and the menu, we immediately placed our order. 3 pasta trios, an "Americano" breakfast (eggs sunny side up), and eggplant parmigiana. Obviously, very quick dishes. Unfortunately something went wrong.  Drinks were empty. Throats were parched. Toddlers were beginning to crack. After waiting one hour, I went to the front desk to ask a manager to look into the situation and if possible provide us with an alternative waitress, as our waitress, Cindy, had not visited our table in 45 minutes. As you would expect, this cleared things up and we received our meals within the next 15 minutes, and even was asked if we'd like any more drinks!  In short, I am not sure if the issue lie with the kitchen or the server, and no one offered any explanations.  I do know, however, that our server was definitely not our advocate, either in making sure our experience was going well, or in tracking the progress of our order.   They comped us 50%, and I asked them to waive the comp as I informed them I would be posting this review but they insisted on the discount, so they owned it, for whatever that is worth.

Xh29Efwy6-ke1302wmGMfQ.text: Went back again this weekend because a visiting family member is a fan of Lidia's show, couldn't tell them no of course.   Had a reservation toward the end of the night, there were maybe only ten other tables. Our server was great, but somehow we ended up getting our first course before we got our drinks. Only one bartender working and he seemed really overwhelmed, seems nuts for a Friday night.   There was what appeared to be a wedding rehearsal dinner in the private area upstairs, maybe fifty or so people, and they only had one valet attendant working. At the end of the night you had scores of drunk annoying wedding party people trying to get their cars and then just not leaving once he brought them up so the guy was getting rightly exasperated. Expecting one guy to handle dozens of cars for a party of at least fifty leaving at one time is absolutely ridiculous. It just doesn't seem like this place staffs appropriately and it makes the employees look bad.

Yb5iuX1HryxS0QO_UI-jYQ.text: I've been a Lidia's fan a long time.  The food is exceptional as is the staff.  Melissa at the bar is a kick if you ever sit at the bar.  The Osso Bucco when offered is 3 very goods.  You really cannot go wrong.  Classic and New World Italian collide perfectly.

It was at the level of self serve breakfast at holiday inn .. the antipasto table was not the cheese & meat delicacies you'd expect at a high quality italian restaurant..tired wilted Caesar and bland escarole soup.. no breadsticks even when we requested them  and tired focaccia..the pasta trio was meh and the grilled Octopus was lukewarm and soaked in oil. 1WdfqmMVsYTpvktHVenapA.text: Perfect place for a nice thanksgiving menu. Chris, our waiter, gave the best of him and take care of us in a perfect thanksgiving spirit. Food menu offers a nice price for quality. Many thanks to the team.

Km_dwghNUKQmP0P0lq2Xug.text: I have been here twice, the most recent was at an outing in which I could sample many different pastas.  Very solid, but nothing blew me away.  I like the atmosphere.

lpPpWH4V2HeBDfdF8-cDtg.text: I had the worst time here I will never be back.  We ate here one other time and it was excellent.  This time it seems like they stopped caring.  I ordered the pasta sampler and that's all I received was a sample, I had to ask for my food after an empty plate was put in front of me.  Then the servers just kept walking past my table and I only got a sample of two other pastas.  My bill was for not even a normal serving of pasta $40.00.  There are plenty of GREAT Italian restaurants in Pittsburgh, don't waste your time and money here.

6Fr7fqaCpZjXTrntUJD-qw.text: Lidia, you should be ashamed! This spot wouldn't have lasted a year in NYC. Citizens of Pittsburgh, don't be fooled. Lidia's is average at best. I ate here when it opened,a and again 4 years later. Nothing has changed. We did have some great bar nibbles, quality cocktails, and a good bottle of wine off of a pretty good list, but the food and service lacked. For starters we were served ice cold meatballs and limp soggy salads. The took away everything and only brought back fresh salads (mind you, we were one of about 10 tables being served that evening!). The entrees were dull and lacked seasoning. The servers were confused (how many times does it take to ask fro fresh pepper?) and our waiter seemed to hand off our table to another server. It's tough to find anything good here. Just another 'poser'.

HII0hPo1p7lYLmTgn1ySJw.text: Portions are huge! Try the gnocchi!   We started off at the bar while we waited for the other half our group. They had fried chickpeas sitting out on the bar which were absolutely delicious. Once our party was all there and we were seated, we decided to order. My brother, sister, and I all decided to go with the 3 course meal. While the rest of my family ordered just one thing. Overall we found that the pasta dishes were far better than the other dishes with the exception of the lamb chops which were prefect. My sister & I both got the ricotta gnudi which was in giant balls and delicious but I would have preferred if it was in smaller gnocchi like shapes. My brother got the burratta which was very good but also huge. My brother's fiance got the ceasar salad which she said was good but also a very large portion.   For our main courses the highlights were definitely the gnocchi, the pasta tasting trio, and the Angello (lamb chops). I ended up getting the Saltimbocca alla  Romano which had great flavors but was overcooked. My sister got the sausage, which was okay, but not as great as we would expect for a restaurant owned by Lydia. The lasagna was also not as good as you would have thought.   The best of the desserts was the gelato trio, but the tiramisu & upside down rhubarb cake was also good (although the rose gelato wasn't so great) .

7W3zIskGWspiJAfMXg4gSA.text: This place is phenomenal! I went here for a first date and we were both truly impressed. The pasta trio is not to be missed and the wait staff make you feel like you are the only people in the restaurant! The desserts are fabulous! I can't say enough about the incredible experience I have had here. I will absolutely be returning and I suggest you give it a try!

UHUEAw3KCdpjvu0S3oWY1g.text: 2.5 Stars  My boyfriend and I each purchased a groupon to Lidias.  The groupon (meal for 2) included a $32 bottle of wine; choice between salad or soup; an all you can eat pasta trio; and dessert (tiramisu).  The first time we went, I would have rated Lidias with one star.  The service was sub-par on a Friday night. We were seated at a table too close to a service station and my seat kept being bumped into.  The bottle of wine we ordered never arrived until after we were mostly finished with our salads.  As for the food, the Caesar salad was OK, but I was really disappointed by the pastas.  The goat cheese ravioli was bland, and the other 2 pastas lacked in flavor as well (rigatoni with an olive oil based sauce and pasta in a meat sauce, which lacked in meat).  The second trip was better, bumping Lidias up to 2.5 stars.  We went midweek (Wednesday), and the service improved, although we still received our bottle of wine after the salads.  The quality and taste of the pastas also improved.  The pasta was fresh and had much more flavor (spaghetti noodles with red peppers, mushroom ravioli, and rigatoni with sweet sausage and onion).  Both times we got the dessert to go.  Our waitress also boxed up the remainder of our all you can eat pasta for us to take home with us (which was nice).  If you have the groupon, I would recommend going on a week night when they aren't as busy for better service.  I would also call ahead to see what pastas they are serving that day.  I wouldn't want to pay full price for the meal, as there are better options for Italian food in the city.

REDujyh4YqW8tPHc1XMZmQ.text: This was the third visit to Lidias in the past 5 years or so. Overall, my impression is that in Pittsburgh,  there are a number of local Italian restaurants where you can get as good or better pasta dishes for a better value. I had the pasta trio and a salad- 30 bucks.  You get as much as you want,  but really how much pasta do you need... The pasta dough itself was very good,  Lidia has that recipe down. The 3 dishes were a pork filled ravioli,  a creamy dish with peas and asparagus,  and a tomato based pasta with small shrimp. They were all decent,  not great.  I did ask for a second helping of the ravioli,  and a few of them were cold in spots,  which tells me that they had been frozen and not boiled long enough.  Service was very good and ambiance was pleasant. Not many in the restaurant on a Wednesday evening at 730. Considering my 3 experiences here,  I have to land on three stars,  because I just don't think the food is memorable enough,  or worth what they are charging considering other great options in the area.

sMZtCip7OjSqUJG75IbMJQ.text: Ate at this resturant while on a business trip. We chose Lidia's because of it's excellent reputation in the downtown Pittsburgh area.  I have to say I was pretty dissapointed by my overall experience at this resturant. Our food was just average, nothing special. I had the gnocchi and the salmon (shared between the two of us.) The service was absolutely horrible. Our food took over an hour and half to come out and we were the only people in the entire resturant. fnlLOscGJ5bNFk9kur7Xbg.text: My husband and I were in town for a concert.  I have always loved watching Lidia on TV and thought it would be a real treat to eat at her restaurant.  Unfortunately, it was a big disappointment.  We went for a late lunch around 1:30.  I ordered the chicken scaloppine and chose the soup.  The soup was described by our server as a fennel, spinach and bean soup.  What I received was void of fennel and spinach.  It was a thick cup of white beans in a tomato base.  Also, very bland.  No salt and pepper shakers on the tables.  This drives me crazy.  The scaloppine wasn't much better.  My husband ordered the sausage and peppers over polenta.  I think he got maybe 4 ounces of sausage and a few peppers.  This restaurant is overpriced for the product you received.  Very disappointing.

D8niSg7MxZ8wJLlZGq4Dhg.text: Great food! Normally pasta is blase, but Lidia's focused on flavor rather than flash. We were here on a Groupon, but service was still spectacular. I'd definitely come back- especially for the mushroom ravioli and wine.

Pcqw7fhinBycqGk5qbtt7w.text: Unless Olive Garden is closed, don't go here.  Staff is excellent though.  Unfortunately Yelp asked to provide more details on review.  For that I apologize Lidia.  Presentation was a -2 on a ten point scale and that was better than the special Chicken Parm. Nice wine selection though. Staff and wine selection is why it got its one star.

lCTJySgwCvPQl7lxvMBxng.text: With so many good Italian places in Pittsburgh I was a little skeptical about a celebrity chef chain. But brunch here was very delicious and generous. The antipasto offerings included a number of crunchy salads that were nice and vibrant. I got the egg/potato/cheese plate which was decadent and more than one person could eat, but it was tasty nonetheless. My husband got the pasta sampler including hand made gnocchi that was silky and smooth. Others at our table were satisfied with the steak, salmon, and trout options as well. Glad I saved a bit of space for dessert although if I'm back I won't sample everything again and instead I'll just focus on the tiramisu, which was by far and away the best sweet offered.

2RrQKo9rPDI2Tvs2aCAJiQ.text: A restaurant that has gone steeply downhill...  It's been roughly 2-3 years since I have been to lidias, an experience in which I remember having decent food and service... Tonight was far different.  Overall, let me say that the restaurant is becoming dated. Colors and decor seem boring and out of style. I didn't get that warm feeling I should in a place where there are white clothes, $12 average glasses of wine (like come on - I looked up the crappy bottle it came from) and waiters everywhere.  The service was horrible. From hostess crew to the bar to the waitress, it was bad. The hostess forgot about us, then when I reminded him we were waiting (40 minutes - despite a reservation), to which he said "oh yes, I was just going to get you"... But he wasn't because we stood there a few minutes while he set the table. Rude.  Did I mention the service was bad? Well, while we were waiting we had a glass of wine each (a steep $13.50 glass each - definitely didn't live up to my expectations). The bar staff wasn't concerned with us and weren't friendly at all. They were chatting to themselves and basically ignoring us.  When we got to the table, it took 10 mins to meet our waitress. Then it took another 15 to order.  Then 50 mins to get our food!!! I had the pasta trio (remember this meal takes no time to cook  - as this is ready made and constantly being served) and my wife had the porkchop. Honestly, we typically enjoy our restaurant food (just read my Casbah review) but our food was really just so-so. My wife's pork chop was fatty and over-cooked (despite the waitress specifically making note of how the chef prefers to cook it medium). My pasta was decent, which I ate, and requested seconds (which is allowed for the trio because they give you very small portions).... However, seconds never came. Waitress didn't even know until I told her politely. Then she blamed new staff working the pasta routes... No good enough reason for me - sorry.   Then the bill.  I ordered the pasta trio for $23 and the waitress asked me if I wanted to upgrade my Salad for $2, to which I approved. However she charged the $36 pasta trio (which comes with desert). I told her this was a mistake and she agreed and ran back with a new check. Now I had a $10 salad and $23 pasta trio. I was expecting $23 +$2 salad upgrade. Nope. So I explained to her politely that I ordered the $23 trio to which she (must have) mistakenly offered me an upgrade. I accepted. However I was told I was wrong and she didn't offer to make this right. Ugh. Seriously you want to fight me on it? Especially when I know I was being appropriately (not like I was trying to score a free meal). Isn't the rule "customer is always right"?  Finally, we felt like the whole restaurant clientele has declined. How many people did we see in tie-dye shirt or wearing hats (literally wearing hats at 8:30pm in a fine dining restaurant)? We saw enough to know that this isn't the lidias we expected.  We won't ever go back or recommend the place.  As far as we are concerned - there is a very good reason that you don't have a problem getting a reservation here (because IT STINKS!).   Avoid!

zjDKIGMfQiIKUfvAnKxnOA.text: Awful.  Our dinner for 5 tasted like a bag of salt!  Awful Restaurant!  Stay Away!

_370f7C6qaFNrxock3Btmw.text: We were so looking forward to the food but our experience was awful. The restaurant is too large with modern decor with hideous red plastic/leatherette chairs but at lunchtime it had no character. There was no background music. The waiter was young and inexperienced. wMfy2Xlq4QSfBK5BcDlbNQ.text: A fantastic Italian meal all around. From the Caesar salads to the rustic pasta trio to the desserts...tiramisu and a variety of cookies! The waitress was very knowledgable about the menu and wine list. Pear ravioli with five cheeses? To die for!

CiAKaRThKUHvZAkTjWcnsQ.text: My coworker had been recommending Lidia's to me for a while, and I'm glad I listened to her and brought my family here for dinner last week.  We had a wonderful Italian meal, and one of the better dining experiences in Pittsburgh so far.  We had a reservation on Saturday night around 6 pm, and used their valet service ($5?  $6?  I forget).  We were seated right away, and we all admired the gorgeous dining room space.  It seems to have been built in an old warehouse - the ceiling is massively high, and there's gorgeous Mondrian-esque glass over the bar.  Very stylish!    I should also say right off the bat that our server was outstanding.  Friendly, funny, and knowledgeable, he was one of the best parts of the whole experience.  He helped us choose a wine which we all enjoyed, and he poured it skillfully.  He was also helpful to us at various points throughout the meal - for example, four of us began with the Insalata di Rucola (split two salads between four people, and they came on separate plates).  The salad sounded amazing, with arugula, pear, walnuts, and gorgonzola (get in mah belleh) but we all noticed that there was quite a lack of...well, pear.  We all had maybe one measly little wedge, and it definitely kept the salad from being as yummy as it should have been.  So we told our server about it, and he immediately brought out a plate full of pear slices.  Redeemed!  And the salad became delicious.  My entree was the Ravioli di Cinghale (ravioli filled with wild boar, in a rosemary sauce) and it was pretty delicious.  Three big raviolis, filled with succulent meat (think pulled pork, but Italian and well-spiced).  The sauce was very very light, but still flavorful.  My dad got the Pasta Trio, and it was hilariously awesome to watch three different guys come by with big bowls, delivering their delicious wares to his plate.  He had a lot of fun with that.  My mom loved her sea bass as well.    Dad's pasta trio came with a dessert, so he got the Crostata di Pere, a sugary pear maple dessert which I think was good, but I don't have really strong memories of it so clearly it didn't bowl me over.  All in all, it was a very good meal with some truly excellent service.  We felt cared for and comfortable, and our bellies were full.  What more could we ask for?

vypLhOqne371mHaqUYan0A.text: I visited a few years back and had quite a pleasurable experience. The Sunday brunch for $25 included your choice of a mimosa or bloody mary, unlimited access to the soup/antipasti/salad buffet, entree of choice and unlimited trips to the dessert table. This is quite a value, plus everything was delicious. The fresh pasta trio is amazing. My only complaint involved the background music. The house system was playing classic rock, which is totally inappropriate and out of place for such a nice establishment.

0MvK8iC_3nEFTzZcv-Nrjw.text: Our boss treated some co-workers and myself to lunch here last week (one of my colleagues was leaving) and had a terrific time. The decor is amazing and so is the food. I had the Porchetta panino (pulled pork Shoulder with horseradish apple salsa) which came with these parsely-seasoned home fries. All of it was amazing. Like Darren (I was so jealous he got to go there back in February and I didn't), I had the Torta di Cioccolatta, and it was godly. The service was on-target too. I love this place and that it's so close to where I now work. Seriously gourmet.

SIRQye74ZYtK8rLrzfK9bg.text: The food was fine. The wine was good. I wouldn't go expecting to be blown away but the execution of the dishes I ate were fine. I did feel like the cook had had enough of making my dish for the 9999th time. A menu refresh shouldn't be too hard with all of Lidia's wonderful recipes. The place I feel, survives on 80% her name, 20% dish quality.

T6tT7XLpyiBGXy9hb8313A.text: Very fancy decor.  Service is top notch.  I had the pasta trio because it looked so delicious!  In actuality, it wasn't as great.  The texture of the pasta was not pleasant.  Mine seemed more uncooked and quite hard to the bite.  I didn't know al dente was this rough..The taste was unrefined like it was packaged and not thoroughly mixed for one of the pastas.  Another had too much salt and butter for my liking.  Of the three pastas, only one was done moderately well and tastes just as good (marinara sauce).  However, for three unlimited pastas, you can't go wrong. I was satisfied, even with the minor problems.  I guess at some point I truly value quantity over quality.  I do gotta say that I also tried a bit of the Gnocchi dish and that was superb.  Very fresh ingredients and each bite was incredibly fulfilling.  Next time I would try more of their signature dishes instead of the pasta trio dish because it is more than likely of sub-par quality when compared to the rest of the items on the menu due to its buffet feat.

9vBIFs2mqGED7Y2p55Txcg.text: I'll be honest, when I go out to eat, usually Italian is the last option on my mind.  While I enjoy it at times, I rarely have cravings for it.  I've been to Lidia's twice now because the people I'm with wanted to go.  But each time I've been thrilled with my dining experience.  The service has been great and the food has been excellent.  I typically don't like tomato based pasta sauces which at Lidia's is no problem because they have such a wide selection of pasta and sauces.    I've had the pasta trio each time that I've gone and I've really enjoyed it.  I've also tried some of the other dishes from the people I'm with and they all have been great.  Really enjoyed the Wild Boar Ravioli - delish!  If your in the Strip and happen to stroll by Lidia's you should check it out b/c you won't be disappointed.  I'll also add, that I'm not a big Tiramisu fan, but Lidia's is the only place that I not only eat Tiramasu but I enjoy it and becomes by dessert of choice.

VSyopqSPVDJj3mU8is2DLw.text: Classy Wonderful establishment. Visited for my mother's 60th birthday.   She was astonished. For that very reason,  I love this place. The food was great the servicew was excellent.  Kudos to Waiter Cheno!!!  Well definitely visit again.

J-OmIYZK2h87X1zy2HKYnw.text: Stop here on a visit to Pittsburg . Was surprised by how great the food was . Coming at brunch was perfect as the anti pasta bar was filled with olives , salads , salmon , mussels , veggies and meats. I chose the pasta trio . Perfect choice as it was a great way to sample three pastas . My mushroom filled ravioli was the highlight of the plate . Every bite had a perfect mix of mushroom and cheese . Service started out great  however at time to receive bill we lost our waitress for about 10 mins. Not the best ending for such a wonderful tasting brunch .

r2xIN4_49vr2qufyuEprXw.text: Sunday Brunch delicious! Stopped in to try this and noted they were busy but not overwhelmed.  Was panhandled at the door by a woman ion distress?  Story was a variation that I had hearts before from different people.  I just look like a sucker I suppose!?  Anyway the service is very good.  Breads were dropped off with a variety of flavored butters.  My server explained the specials to me and my choices were made.  I chose the Cabbage rolls stuffed with a variety of meats and then off to the Antipasti buffet.  Great fresh Caesar Salad and some quiche for beginnings.  Tried some marinated mushroom s and olives.  My server checked on my progress and when I was ready they brought my entree.  Delicious to a T!  Then for a short visit to the Dessert Bar scrumptious Tira Misu and other delectable tempting confections.  My meal was priced just right for there quality and taste.

bCpLcc8IFrn_baSGfRtyiw.text: Great food and service, very pleased with my Valentine's day dinner here.  Planning to come back to try more of their fare, since their Valentine's day menu was limited.

QiJns8eUirgx4AVCNTTX8w.text: Lidia's has the best brunch in town--hands down.  For twenty-five bucks you get a drink, fresh breads w/ yummy spreads, "help yourself" table buckling with cured meats and cheese, numerous salads and sides, pasta trio sampling, and a trip or two to the dessert table.  I should add that if the pasta sampler is not to your liking you can order other items, including salmon.  I always get the pasta sampler and the choices range from good to out of this world.  The ravioli dishes are consistently excellent and often filled with seasonal ingredients.  The side dishes are also very good, and while a romaine salad and bean and tuna salad are staples, other side dishes rotate, according to what's available/in season.  Wide variety of desserts at the dessert table.  The tiramisu is out of this world--served in individual ramekin cups.  Be sure to leave a little room for at least one of those little guys--you won't be sorry!  I'd give Lidia's five stars but their service is sometimes spotty.  I've gone when it's not overly busy, only to wait, wait, wait.  If you're not in a hurry and you're there for brunch, it's really not a big deal, but if you are looking for prompt service or have plans, like to go somewhere afterwards, this could be a pain.  I took my parents for dinner for their anniversary and the poor service was embarrassing.  At this dinner my mom also ordered wine and she got--no exaggeration--about 2-3 tablespoons in the glass.  I buttonholed the manager before we left and while he apologized that was it, no offer of even another wine (hopefully with a fuller glass).  But in the 5+ years I've gone, that was the worst experience I had.

cl8WDY39nu_51cQfjKQ5aw.text: Oh Lidia, oh Lida, oh have you met Lidia, oh Lidia the tattoo'd lady....  Show tunes aside because I have no idea if the Lidia of Lidia's even has a tattoo, this place is a gem.   My boyfriend and I came here based on a recommendation. We were hungry and early for our reservation, so we sat, ate and drank at the bar for a while. On a Saturday night, this place is rockin - so dont even try coming in here without a reservation - unless you want to sit at the bar. The bar was surprisingly not busy.   One of the bartenders was a lot more attentive than the other and even helped me find a wine to pair with my appetizer. Once sat at our table we switched from cocktails to wine. Decent wine list (I say decent because I will never spend more than $40 on a bottle of wine and they had some options in that category). The bread basket was amazing. We both ordered the pasta trio with the salad and dessert.   Our server was great - helpful and attentive, through our reservation on Open Table, we were able to list allergies, he made very sure that what we ordered didnt include anything that we might die from (thank you!). My only complaint about my experience was that bussers didnt really bus until after patrons left the table- my empty bread basket sat at my table for the entire meal, as did a wine glass, an empty cocktail glass....  Bread + pasta trio = CARB OVERLOAD  I rolled out of this place very happy. A great local place when in the 'burgh.

6BsOcmga2JZ4SGYbvJbX3Q.text: We had a 5 PM reservation, but it was 4:30 PM and we had no more places to go in the neighborhood to kill time, so we asked to be seated early. The hostess agreed to seat us early. I ordered the frico (sausage, broccoli rabe, potato, leeks) for my appetizer, but the waitress told me that the menu that she gave me was outdated and that the frico was not available to order. I ordered a caesar salad and calamari instead. For my entree, I ordered the ravioli di cinghiale (gigantic boar ravioli). My husband, who is part Italian and lived in Italy when he was a child, said that he was unimpressed with the menu, and he simply ordered salmon. The caesar salad tasted sour and needed more cheese. The calamari, boar ravioli, and salmon tasted good. The wait staff was nice and brought out our food and drinks on time. We were not thrilled with the taste of the food for the price, so we will not return.
